Whoobe multipage support

Whoobe supports websites multipage generation.


Starting from the homepate, Whoobe will collect all articles to be published with a deep scan thru each article found.

In this way the generation process will create all the requested routes automatically


Multipage generation is enabled by default.



Target folder

In local environment you can decide to prerender your landing page/website to a custom target folder of your file system.

In this way you can deploy or transfer just the target folder to your webserver without any other settings.


Deploy to Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare pages, Github pages

Set a repo of the target folder and then connect the repo to your project on Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare, Github pages.

Commit your repo and your website will be automatically published with the last build.

We suggest to check the build result before to commit. To do this go to the root folder of the generator (whoobe-nuxt) of your installation and run


Using yarn:


$ yarn start


Using npm



$ npm run start


SEO support


Whoobe support SEO settings for the each page/article based on data (title and description) that you set.


PWA mode


At the moment this feature is still in development and will be implemented in the next release.
